meanings.definition: To look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter by interpreting the characters or symbols of which it is composed.
meanings.sent1: She readds the storybook to understand the plot.
meanings.sent2: He readds the instructions before starting the project.
meanings.sent3: The detective readds the note to find hidden clues.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes readd the emotions behind the handwritten letter.
meanings.sent5: Readding the map carefully, she plotted the route in her mind.

meanings.definition: To utter aloud by or as if by reading.
meanings.sent1: The teacher readds the poem to the class.
meanings.sent2: He readds the lines of the play with emotion.
meanings.sent3: The parrot readds the words in a funny voice.
meanings.sent4: His voice readds the ancient words with power.
meanings.sent5: Readding the speech, she practiced her delivery for hours.

meanings.definition: To obtain information from a written or printed source.
meanings.sent1: She readds the textbook to prepare for the exam.
meanings.sent2: He readds the article to gather facts for his report.
meanings.sent3: The journalist readds the document for breaking news.
meanings.sent4: The historian readds the diary for insights into the past.
meanings.sent5: Readding the manual, she learned how to assemble the furniture.
